alert.note: Alert for Randolph (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 17 at 6:26AM CDT until June 17 at 6:45AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM CDT FOR RANDOLPH...STE. GENEVIEVE AND EASTERN ST. FRANCOIS COUNTIES... At 625 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Coulterville to near Ste. Genevieve to Desloge, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Farmington, Chester, Ste. Genevieve, Sparta, Bremen, Park Hills, Steeleville, Percy, Coulterville, Tilden, Evansville, Bloomsdale, St. Mary, Knob Lick, Weingarten, Womac, Rocky Ridge, Coffman, Eden and Preston. This also includes Hawn State Park and Felix Valle House State Park. This includes Interstate 55 in Missouri between exits 141 and 157. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in St Louis.
